org.vaadin.addons.criteriacore
Class AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.vaadin.addons.criteriacore.AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the Entity type returned by the query being defined
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryDefinition
Direct Known Subclasses:
BeanTupleQueryDefinition
public abstract class AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<T>
extends Object
implements org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryDefinition

Definition of a JPA 2.0 Criteria Query. Extends LazyQueryDefinition instead of EntityQueryDefinition to avoid passing the Entity class.

Author:
jflamy

Constructor Detail

AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition

public AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition(javax.persistence.EntityManager entityManager,
                                       boolean applicationManagedTransactions,
                                       Class<?> entityClass,
                                       int batchSize)
Simple constructor, used when extending the class.

Parameters:
entityManager - the entityManager that gives us access to the database and cache
applicationManagedTransactions - true unless the JPA persistence unit is defined by the container
entityClass - the class for the entity (should be the same as T.class)
batchSize - how many entities to recover at one time.

AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition

public AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition(javax.persistence.EntityManager entityManager,
                                       boolean applicationManagedTransactions,
                                       Class<T> entityClass,
                                       int batchSize,
                                       Object[] nativeSortPropertyIds,
                                       boolean[] nativeSortPropertyAscendingStates)
Constructor for simple usage. With this constructor, entities are retrieved and sorted.

Parameters:
entityManager - the entityManager that gives us access to the database and cache
applicationManagedTransactions - true unless the JPA persistence unit is defined by the container
entityClass - the class for the entity (should be the same as T.class)
batchSize - how many entities to recover at one time.
nativeSortPropertyIds - the property names to be sorted
nativeSortPropertyAscendingStates - for each property name, true means sort in ascending order, false in descending order

defineQuery

protected abstract javax.persistence.criteria.Path<?> defineQuery(javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder cb,
                                                                  javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<?> cq)
Define FROM and WHERE part of query. This definition is shared between the query returning items and the count. That is, the default implementations of getCountQuery() and getSelectQuery() both call this method in order to guarantee that they ar consistent with one another. Because of this sharing method must not call cb.select. The method should not call cb.setOrdering() because only the select method needs it and sorting has a major performance impact.

Advanced usage: If the query needs to perform ordering on elements other than those returned (for example, if it needs to sort on the columns of a join) then this method and getOrdering(Path, CriteriaBuilder) will both need to be overridden in such a way that the Join in the query are visible to both methods. In other words, the joins should be defined as Join fields, set by defineQuery, and accessed by getOrdering.

Parameters:
cb - the current query builder
cq - the query as built so far
Returns:
the root for the query

getBatchSize

public int getBatchSize()
Specified by:
getBatchSize in interface org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryDefinition

getCountQuery

public abstract javax.persistence.TypedQuery<?> getCountQuery()
This method returns the number of entities. The returned type is actually guaranteed to be a Long, but implementation choices in some JPA libraries currently prevent us from doing this with a type-safe declaration.

Returns:
number of entities.

getOrdering

protected List<javax.persistence.criteria.Order> getOrdering(javax.persistence.criteria.Path<?> t,
                                                             javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder cb)
Applies the sort state. A JPA ordering is created based on the saved sort orders.

Parameters:
t - the root or joins from which columns are being selected
cb - the criteria builder for the query being built
Returns:
a list of Order objects to be added to the query.

getSelectQuery

public abstract javax.persistence.TypedQuery<T> getSelectQuery()
This method adds the ordering and the parameters on a query definition. defineQuery(CriteriaBuilder, CriteriaQuery) creates the portion of the query that is shared between counting and retrieving. This method returns a runnable query by adding the ordering and setting the parameters.

Returns:
a runnable TypedQuery

setParameters

protected javax.persistence.TypedQuery<?> setParameters(javax.persistence.TypedQuery<?> tq)
Set parameters values. Provide values for the named parameters defined viasetNamedParameterValues(java.util.Map). This method is overridden by subclasses that define additional parameters. Subclasses should call super.setParameters to ensure that setNamedParameterValues work.

Parameters:
tq - the runnable query that needs to have its parameter set
Returns:
the query after its parameters have been set.

Parameters:
sortPropertyIds - Properties participating in the sorting.
sortPropertyAscendingStates - List of sort direction for the properties.
